216001.name: Cosmonut
216001.description:
User Summary
Mainly a maze game, where you have to find your way to the control room of your robot to make it stronger; you can shoot alien invaders with your laser.
Around the maze you also find a lot of doors porting you to various arcade mini-games that need to be completed in order to complete the level

Intro screen
You are the last hope
Enter the maze inside your robot
Destroy all invading aliens
Finish the war

216002.name: Colossus Chess 2.0
216002.description:
Colossus Chess is a series of chess-playing computer programs developed by Martin Bryant, commercially available for various home computers in the 1980s.

Bryant started Colossus Chess in 1983, using his White Knight Mk 11 program, winner of the 1983 European Microcomputer Chess Championship, as a basis. It was developed on an Apple II, but was first commercially released for Commodore 64 as Colossus Chess 2.0 (CDS Micro Systems, 1984)

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colossus_Chess Colossus Chess]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

216003.name: Colossus Chess 3.0
216003.description:
Colossus Chess is a series of chess-playing computer programs developed by Martin Bryant, commercially available for various home computers in the 1980s.

Version 3.0 was released in 1984 for the Atari 8-bit family of computers (published by English Software)

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colossus_Chess Colossus Chess]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

216004.name: Colossus Chess X
216004.description:
Colossus Chess is a series of chess-playing computer programs developed by Martin Bryant, commercially available for various home computers in the 1980s.

The program was subsequently ported to Atari ST (1988), Amiga (1989) and IBM PC (1990) under the title Colossus Chess X. The new releases featured four chess sets and enhanced graphics developed with the assistance of Gary Thomlinson and Carl Cropley. The opening book was extended to 11,000 positions, and the program had the ability to learn from past playing experiences.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colossus_Chess%23Colossus_Chess_X Colossus Chess]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

216005.name: Eliksir
216005.description:
On the periphery of the hidden forest, not far from the cave of the fallen dragon, every thirty-three years an ancient tournament is held. For centuries the druids and their apprentices come to this magic forest to harvest all the best ingredients for their elixir.

Back in the old days, in order to prevent recipe from falling into the wrong hands, the first druids have made the key with words through which to come up with the right ingredients. During the tournament, with the key droids utter keywords, but faithful apprentices have to understand those keywords and reveal where the ingredients are hidden.

Now you also have the opportunity to enter this magical world and try your luck in an ancient tournament, decipher keywords, find the ingredients, help your druid!

In Eliksir, two teams compete to see who can make their elixir faster by finding all ingredients. Druids give one-word clues that can point to multiple words on the board. Their teammates try to guess their own words while avoiding those that belong to the opposing team. And everyone wants to avoid the deadly black ingredient.

Can you find help your druid find all your ingredients before the other team, find out in Eliksir.

216006.description:
Fancy Animals is a rummy-type card game where players choose one of four fancy animal portrait boards and use the material cards to make runs in order to acquire fancy clothing items.

On every turn players will either take a card from the draw deck or play cards from their hand to the table. They can make runs entirely from their own hand OR by creatively rearranging cards that others have already played. With each card being able to be played two different ways, players who are best at creatively out-thinking their opponents are sure to acquire the fanciest clothing!

If a player is able to make a run with the correct number of cards in the correct suite that player may take a piece of fancy clothing (corresponding to the run that was just made) and place it by the portrait board. Players will also be able to activate special cards that unlock the ability to break the rules in specific ways.

Different clothing types are worth different points and each animal has a specific clothing type they will receive bonus points for.

Once one animal has all four sides of its portrait filled with clothing all other players have one more turn before the game ends.

The animal with the most points wins!

If you like games like Rummikub you'll love Fancy Animals!
216006.name: Fancy Animals

216008.name: Die Kolonisten: Das Bündnis der Sechs Städte
216008.description: The Scenario is based on the second era. The game board is split into six cities. Jumping from market to market you can reach different cities and try to complete tasks to win the game after 5 years.

216009.name: HoloGrid: Monster Battle
216009.description: HoloGrid: Monster Battle is a symbiotic combination of physical components (two decks of 36 cards and two device stands) and a mobile app that uses the camera on a tablet device to render the cards as monsters, very much in the style of the chess-like game that one can see played by R2-D2 and Chewbacca during the original Star Wars movie. This is not a card game that happens to be playable in an AR fashion, but rather a video game that employs a physical CCG to build your monster teams.

216010.description:
This Game 4 card was handed out during GenCon 2016 and BGG.Con 2016.

This Spell carries the following ability:

Gain 1 [ATTACK]. Do not reveal Dark Arts events next turn.
216010.name: Harry Potter: Hogwarts Battle – Spell: Silencio!

216011.description:
This Game 5 card was handed out during GenCon 2016 and BGG.Con 2016.

This Ally carries the following ability:

Gain 1 [INFLUENCE]. If you discard this, gain 1 [ATTACK], 1 [LIFE], and draw a card.
216011.name: Harry Potter: Hogwarts Battle – Ally: The Dursleys

216012.description:
This Game 7 card was handed out during GenCon 2016 and BGG.Con 2016.

This Item carries the following ability:

Gain 2 [ATTACK]. You may remove this from the game after playing it to automatically destroy a Horcrux.
216012.name: Harry Potter: Hogwarts Battle – Item: Basilisk Fang

216013.name: Panic!
216013.description:
Panic! is a card game of commodity trading between the wealthiest of gentlemen. Players attempt to corner the market for the scarcest commodities while dumping or trading the least valuable. Gameplay is fast and entertaining as the market is constantly shifting and your opponents and continually changing the dynamics of the trading floor.

Panic! includes three games in one box. Bull Market is a bidding game designed by James Ernest, Greg Parsons and Mick Sullivan in which secret information can make or break your day's excursion to the trading floor. Bear Market, designed by James Ernest, is a fast-playing drafting game in which making the best of what comes your way is key. Inside Traders, designed by Jeff Horger, is a trick-taking variant using the same basic concepts.

All of the games rely on a Panic! stage where there is a flurry of dumped commodities when players begin to see what direction the current hand is going.

The box includes ninety commodity suit cards, a value tracking board, and nine commodity tokens.

boardgameintegration: Aye, Dark Overlord! The Red Box
Aye, Dark Overlord! The Red Box
216014.description:
Aye, Dark Overlord! is a fantasy party game filled with humor that's fast to play and easy to learn.

Each player is an evil goblin servant of the evil Dark Overlord — Rigor Mortis, the Master of all Evils — and all of them are gathered at the Dark Overlord's knees to explain why they brought that last important mission, ordered by "His Evil Excellence" himself, to failure again. Panic wraps you in its freezing grip; what can you do to save your poor skin? Could you say you are not the one to blame, but your inept companions? Yes, of course, that's the solution! There is only one little problem: They've probably got exactly the same idea...and the Dark Overlord is not known for his mercy...

This roleplaying game is all about telling lies and shifting the blame on your poor fellow ones, so the righteous wrath of your Master can give them what they deserve!

Aye, Dark Overlord! The Green Box is a new version of Aye, Dark Overlord! that is playable on its own while also capable of being combined with the original game. The Green Box adds entirely new mechanisms to the game, including the Back of the Line and No Way! Action cards. Occult Hunters, The Best from the Labyrinth, The Jar with a Thousand Demons, and Impossible Math Calculations are just a few of the new hints in The Green Box, giving you more stories to shield yourself from the Dark Overlord's wrath.
216014.name: Aye, Dark Overlord! The Green Box

216015.name: Dare Duel
216015.description:
Dare Duel is a card game where players take turns drawing cards and selecting words or phrases to create sexy dares to act out.

Players also compete for points when creating their dares, and the first player to reach 25 points wins the game.

The winner then gets to decide how climax is reached using words and phrases found on special reward cards.

With hundreds of different words and phrases to choose from, the combinations are almost endless, making every game unique.

Sexual preference does not matter, and players can either enjoy the game with their partner or a group of friends.

216016.name: Equipment Emporium
216016.description:
From the Introduction:

This supplement provides additional options for equipment, adventuring gear, and other items for play under the Basic Fantasy Role-Playing Game rules. If you do not already have a copy of the Basic Fantasy RPG rules, please visit the website and download a copy.

The purpose of this supplement is to provide a single source for expanded equipment, as well as provide some guidelines for other materials, goods, and services of which players may find themselves in need. As with any supplements, these are suggestions, and GMs are encouraged to pick and choose what they want to use.

216017.name: Magic-User Options: A Basic Fantasy Supplement
216017.description:
From the Introduction:

These optional rules are presented buffet-style for the GM to pick and choose among based on the needs and flavor of the campaign. Six different ways of combining options based on campaign style (close to core rules, dark fantasy, heroic fantasy, high magic, military fantasy, and Old School) are given in Appendix A. This supplement specifically avoids options which are the focus of other supplements such as 0-level spells (AKA cantrips) or Magic-User subclasses, though those supplements are listed in Appendix C. The terms Magic-User' and 'magician' are used interchangeably throughout this supplement for the sake of variety.

216018.name: Thief Options: A Basic Fantasy Supplement
216018.description:
From the Introduction:

This supplement provides additional options for Thief-class characters for use with the Basic Fantasy Role-Playing Game rules. If you do not already have a copy of the Basic Fantasy RPG rules, please visit the website and download a copy.

216019.name: The Fine Art of Monster Conversion: A Basic Fantasy RPG Supplement
216019.description:
From the Introduction:

Basic Fantasy Role-Playing Game (BFRPG) is based upon the d20 game engine. This short document will show the process of converting monster statistics from the d20 SRD format to BFRPG. As an example, we will convert a 3.5e monster.

216020.name: Spell Channeling Items: A Basic Fantasy RPG Supplement
216020.description:
From the Introduction:

This supplement provides information for spell channeling items, a new type of magic item, under the Basic Fantasy
Role-Playing Game rule system.

Spell Channeling Items
Magical Spell Channeling Items are a different sort of magical item that allows a spell caster to convert the magical energies of currently memorized spells into another predetermined spell. For example, a Wand of Magic Missile Channeling would convert any other currently memorized first level spell into a Magic Missile spell cast as if the caster actually had that spell memorized instead.

216021.name: 0 Level Spells: A Basic Fantasy Supplement
216021.description:
From the Introduction:

This supplement to the Basic Fantasy Role-Playing Game rule system provides additional, very low level spells for Clerics and Magic-Users.

Have you ever thought that your magic-user should be able to sweep a floor without resorting to a fifth-level spell? Or that your cleric should always be able to pray for something, even at first level? This supplement gives you your chance!

216022.name: Alignment: A Basic Fantasy RPG Supplement
216022.description:
From the Introduction:

Alignment is a way of describing the moral code of a creature. These rules are for use with the Basic Fantasy Role-Playing Game rules.

Basics of Alignment
A creature’s general moral and personal attitudes are represented by its alignment: lawful good, neutral good, chaotic good, lawful neutral, neutral, chaotic neutral, lawful evil, neutral evil, or chaotic evil.

Depending on the campaign, the GM may require that players choose an alignment for their characters. Alignment is a tool for developing your character's identity. It is not a straitjacket for restricting your character. Each alignment represents a broad range of personality types or personal philosophies, so two characters of the same alignment can still be quite different from each other.

216023.name: Alignment Creator's Kit: A Basic Fantasy RPG Supplement
216023.description:
From the Introduction:

Alignment is a way of describing the moral code of a creature. This supplement is intended to help the Game Master create a system of alignments for his or her own game world. These rules are for use with the Basic Fantasy Role-Playing Game rules.

Alignment, in a role-playing game, refers to a system of defining ethics and morality in the campaign world. The very first role-playing game possessed an alignment system, basically defining “sides” to which the heroes and monsters belonged. Later games have expanded on this concept in several details. How alignments are defined, judged, and applied in the game world has long been a point of contention

216024.name: Armor and Shields: A Basic Fantasy RPG Supplement
216024.description:
From the Introduction:

This supplement provides additional armor and shields for play under the Basic Fantasy Role-Playing Game rules.

The tables below provide an expanded range of armor and shields for use in the game. Availability of these additional items is at the discretion of the Game Master, of course.

Unless otherwise specified, a suit of armor takes 10 rounds minus the character's Dexterity bonus to put on or take off. Armor is often made of differing materials, especially shields. Some Plate Armor is made of bronze or possibly some other alloy, though it is most commonly made of steel. Differing materials and their effect on weight, cost and AC is beyond the scope of this document. Game Masters are encouraged to make these adjustments as they see fit while adhering to the simple and basic nature of the Basic Fantasy RPG.

216025.name: Background Skills: A Basic Fantasy RPG Supplement
216025.description:
From the Introduction:

This document presents an alternative method for assigning background skills to characters in the Basic Fantasy Role-Playing Game.

The BFRPG core rules allow you to create brave fighters, devout clerics, cunning thieves and brilliant magic-users for the sake of adventuring in varied fantasy worlds. But sometimes adventurers – both during adventures and between them - know how to do things other than fight, pray, sneak or cast spells. These alternative and optional rules try to cover some of these secondary skills.

216026.name: Combat Options: A Basic Fantasy RPG Supplement
216026.description:
From the Introduction:

This supplement additional combat options for player and non-player characters for use with the Basic Fantasy Role-Playing Game rules.

This document contains various optional combat rules. The Game Master must choose which, if any, of these rules apply in his or her game. In order to make these options easier to use, each
optional rule has a checkbox beside it. The GM may wish to print a copy of this supplement and mark the checkboxes for the rules he or she has chosen.

216027.name: Equipment Packs: A Basic Fantasy RPG Supplement
216027.description:
From the Introduction:

This supplement provides an alternate method of equipping new characters for play under the Basic Fantasy Role-Playing Game rules.

Below you will find a variety of pre-selected equipment packs which will permit players to quickly equip their characters. The total weight of each pack has been included for further convenience (less the weight of any gold included). Choosing equipment in this way replaces the standard method of rolling for starting money; if you use this system, do not also use the starting money roll.

All characters start with the Basic Pack and a class-based pack of their choice. They may also spend their additional gold on the bonus packs, on items in the normal equipment list or to upgrade weapons or armor in their class pack. With the GM's approval, a character may swap a given weapon for one of similar power.

216028.name: New Spells: A Basic Fantasy RPG Supplement
216028.description:
From the Introduction:

This supplement includes a number of new spells, as well as rules for using spells of the 7 th level. The spells in this document have been provided by a number of people; please read Section 15 of the OGL (on the last page of this document) for a full list.

216029.name: Secondary Skills: A Basic Fantasy RPG Supplement
216029.description:
From the Introduction:

This supplement defines a new system of Secondary Skills for player and non-player characters for use with the Basic Fantasy Role-Playing Game rules.

Any additional skills from a character's background are considered secondary skills. These are skills that the character has from before their adventuring lives or skills that could be considered part of their character class. It is a method to flesh out a character and make them more unique.

216030.name: Sentient Weapons: A Basic Fantasy RPG Supplement
216030.description:
From the Introduction:

This supplement provides information for Sentient Weapons, a special type of magic item, under the Basic Fantasy Role-Playing Game rule system.

Some magic weapons have an intelligence all their own. Only weapons proper (i.e. not ammunition) will be intelligent, and it is unusual for a sentient weapon to be smaller than a shortsword. These weapons think and feel the same way characters do and should be treated much like NPCs. Sentient weapons have extra abilities and sometimes extraordinary powers and special purposes. In general, less than 1% of eligible magic weapons have intelligence; it is recommended that the GM place each one specially, and not give them out as part of randomly generated treasures.

216031.name: Quick Character Generation: A Basic Fantasy RPG Supplement
216031.description:
From the Introduction:

This document provides a set of tables to quickly generate a player character randomly, including not only statistics but also backstory. While this is presented as a Basic Fantasy RPG supplement, in fact it may be useful in a variety of different games.

216032.name: Old Monsters as New Races: A Basic Fantasy RPG Supplement
216032.description:
From the Introduction:

This supplement provides information for adding race options to the Basic Fantasy Role-Playing Game rule system.
Contents:
Part 1: COMBINATION CLASSES
Part 2: MONSTERS AS RACES

216033.description:
Expand the gameplay of Santorini! The Golden Fleece expansion adds more Gods like the magical Hecate or the mysterious Hades and also Heroes like Hercules and Achilles! Also included is a Golden Fleece figure, which can give any player touching it the power of a God!

While Heroes have powerful abilities, they can only be used once per game. This is a great way to balance out skill gaps or introduce new players to the world of Santorini!
216033.name: Santorini: Golden Fleece
boardgamefamily: Games by the Game Artisans of Canada
boardgamepodcastepisode: #37: Santorini review; Evolution: Climate on tap; Unlock! First Impressions

216036.name: Blood and Fog
216036.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Heavy mists have plagued the area around Phlan for weeks, even after the reported death of Vorgansharax, the Maimed Virulence. People have been disappearing in those deadly fogs, and now dead bodies are turning up. A D&D Adventurer’s League adventure set in the Quivering Forest.

A 4-hour Adventure for 5th – 10th Level Characters

This adventure originally debuted as custom content for the U-Con convention in Ann Arbor, Michigan.

216037.name: Window to the Past
rpgseries: DDAO - D&D Adventurers League Authors Only
216037.description:
Publisher's blurb:

When a Thayan research expedition returns from the Glacier of the White Wyrm with only two survivors that are reduced to whispering about an ancient pyramid under the ice, perhaps it is time to discover just what scares the life out of a nation of necromancers.

A 4-Hour Adventure for 5th – 10th, 11th – 16th, or 17th – 20th Level Characters.

User summary:

This scenario was created as part of the "Author's Only" program and subsequently released to the public by the author. The download typically includes map files for use with Campaign Cartographer 3.

216039.description:
Instead of using cardboard tokens for Dark Stone then next time your Posse heads into the mines, step up to a deluxe set of Dark Stone!

Each Deluxe Dark Stone set contains 25 pieces of plastic Dark Stone (in 3 different shapes) in a custom printed Shadows of Brimstone drawstring canvas bag.
boardgameaccessory: Shadows of Brimstone: City of the Ancients
Shadows of Brimstone: Frontier Town Expansion
Shadows of Brimstone: Swamps of Death
216039.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Deluxe Dark Stone Set

216042.description:
Vs System 2PCG: Legacy is a set of two hundred cards that expands on all of the Marvel Universe teams released to date for the Vs System 2PCG line: The Marvel Battles, The Defenders, and A-Force. Each team gains a new main character and a few supporting characters, including fan favorites such as Captain Britain, Psylocke, Mister Sinister, Taskmaster, Squirrel Girl, and Elektra.

Vs System 2PCG: Legacy also includes replacement main character cards for Thanos as the original cards in The Marvel Battles set were subsequently shown to distort play on the tournament scene.
216042.name: Vs System 2PCG: Legacy

216043.description:
Description from the publisher:

Feudum: Squirrels & Conifers is a "mini-expansion" featuring 50 tasty squirrels and 6 wooden conifer trees that bring the board's topography to life! This expansion replaces the green food cubes with pink ones and creates a multiplying food source on the map. NOTE: The pink cubes are more accessible for color blind players and may also be used apart from the expansion rules.

RULES:

- Remove the green food cubes from the game and use the pink "squirrel" cubes instead.

- Whenever a brown wood cube is placed on the map (during setup or replenishment), place a conifer tree next to it, if one is available.

- Place a pink cube beside any tree you just placed and beside any tree without a squirrel during replenishment.
216043.name: Feudum: Squirrels & Conifers

216044.name: The Vault of the Devourer
rpgseries: The Ruined Tower of the Tempest Mage
216044.description:
Part One of the Ruined Tower of the Tempest Mage

From the introduction:

Amid the gales and snowy Earthspur Mountains, the tumbling ruins of the ancient Tempest Mage’s tower brood over the village of Windy Valley. When a kidnapper flees into the ruins, it’s up to a group of adventurers to apprehend the rogue and save his victim from the vault below.

A four-hour adventure for 1st-4th level characters.

216045.name: Caretaker Retribution
216045.description:
The stars are going out. A team is sent to find out why. They discover the cause and try to stop it. They don’t make it out alive. Caretaker Retribution is a 6DOF shooter for PC and Mac that also works on HTC Vive and Oculus Rift.

Source: The Game Website.

216046.name: DWVR
216046.description:
User Summary

Feel like an action hero while switching seamlessly between an arsenal of guns, swords and spells as you blast your way through murderous hordes.

216047.name: Ant-gravity: Tiny's Adventure
216047.description:
Combine your 4-direction gravity manipulation ability with your platformer skills to overcome the challenges of this 2D side-scroller game.

Source: The Game Website.

216048.name: Minimal
216048.description:
Unique logic game with simple controls and addictive gameplay. There is no story, no clutter - everything is simple, minimalistic. Whole game tries to keep you focused on one simple goal, which is solving current puzzle.

Source: The Game Website.

216049.name: Elena
216049.description:
User Summary

Elena is an atmospheric first person exploration game in which the player discovers the story of a young couple.

216050.name: BECMI Thief (Revised)
216050.description:
From the publisher blurb:

"D&D -> Thief/Rogue, Revised (2016)

Back in the '80s I wrote the BECM version/edition of the D&D game. The span of 36 character levels was a requirement. When I spread the thief abilities over that range, it was a huge mistake, because hardly anybody played higher than Level 12.

So I've revised it, added new stuff, made it lots more playable and interesting. And I've gone with "Rogue" as a title, because 'thief' is too limiting. (Jack-of-all-Trades, or Factotum, would be even better.)

If you like, give it a download at Piazza (link below) and use that message board to tell me what still needs fixing."

rpgseries: GEO - Living Greyhawk Geoff Regional Adventure
216051.name: A Gathering of Shadows
216051.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Geoff Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A young woman seeks to help a dear friend, unaware of the dark places to which her quest will lead. Places she dare not tread alone. Light and dark, friend and foe, all are pieces in a game that will go far beyond the fathoming of one of Geoff’s daughters.

A Geoff regional adventure for APLs 4-10, and Part 1 of the Daughters of Geoff series.

rpgseries: GEO - Living Greyhawk Geoff Regional Adventure
216052.name: Delusions of Grandeur
216052.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Geoff Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Word comes from the Stark Mounds that all is not well. Strange happenings force the gnomes to accept help from the outside world. A few brave adventurers are chosen to solve the problems and perhaps find more than they bargained for.

A Geoff regional adventure for APLs 2-8, and Part 1 of the Stark
Contrasts series.

rpgseries: GEO - Living Greyhawk Geoff Regional Adventure
216053.name: A Gathering of Storms
216053.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Geoff Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The northwestern cantrevi of Geoff are still wild from their years under the domination of the giants. Bandits, lost steadings, and feral tribes all vie with one another and the returning refugees for the last morsels the land can give. With hunger quickly becoming famine, can someone find a way check the chaos and uncover the mysteries that hold the region in thrall?

A Geoff Regional Adventure for APLs 2-8 and Part One of the Path of Purity series.

rpgseries: GEO - Living Greyhawk Geoff Regional Adventure
216054.name: Lady of Oak & Oracles
216054.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Geoff Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Where there was one, now there are four. Boldly they embrace the coming conflict on the Shadow Plane and ask you to join them on their journey. The physical contest will test your bodies but the battle itself may hinge on the internal struggles of Geoff's greatest daughter.

A Geoff Regional Adventure for APLs 4-10 and Part Two of the Four Daughters of Geoff.

216055.name: By Light of Twain Moons
rpgseries: GEO - Living Greyhawk Geoff Regional Adventure
216055.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Geoff Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A rare conjunction of two moons, one full and one crescent, haunts your dreams. A sense of urgency tugs at your mind. But to do what? The answer, it would seem, can be found in the Hornwood forest of all places.

A Geoff Regional adventure for APLs 4-10, and Part One of The Crescent Moon Rising series.

216056.name: Blood Feud
rpgseries: GEO - Living Greyhawk Geoff Regional Adventure
216056.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Geoff Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The half-orcs of Clear Sky have arrived in Melgorn, and they have started building their homes in the new town of Clear Sky. Their new neighbors drop by for a visit, but old enemies threaten the developing relationship. The PCs may be the ones who keep things from falling apart.

A Geoff regional adventure for APLs 2-10.

216057.name: Breath of the Ancients
rpgseries: GEO - Living Greyhawk Geoff Regional Adventure
216057.description:
A Two-Round Living Greyhawk Geoff Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A new development threatens to annihilate the inhabitants of the Dim Forest. With a dead Bondmate and a withered Heart, everyone in or near the Forest is in dire need of help. Will you be the one to walk the path of fallen heroes?

A Geoff Regional adventure for APLs 6-12, and Part 3 of the Cycle of Darkened Mirrors series, as well as Part 2 of the Crescent Moon Rising series.

rpgseries: GEO - Living Greyhawk Geoff Regional Adventure
216058.name: A Whisper of Thunder
216058.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Geoff Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The followers of the Ffordd Purdeb, or Path of Purity, are slowly gathering strength, particularly in the wilder cantrevs yet to be fully resettled. Many yearn for a return to simpler days, and fear that they may have regained their homes only to lose their identities among a sea of foreign mercenaries. A fragment of ancient druidic lore may lead to the healing so many are seeking, both for the Land and its people… or it may destroy a fragile nation still reeling from a terrible war.

A Geoff Regional Module for APLs 2-10 and Part Two of the Path of Purity.

216059.name: Exile In The Forest
216059.description:
An adventure game of ancient India set in the world of The Mahabharata.

The five Pandava brothers are exiled to the forest for 12 years before they can claim the throne of Hastinapura. But there is no doubt their evil cousins will not relinquish it when they return and so those 12 years must be spent gathering allies and weapons to prepare for war.

You'll be exploring a map, dealing with events as you move, and defending against attacks with lots of dice. There are four kingdoms whose allegiance you seek and you can do quests for each one of them as well as personal quests to improve yourself for the coming war.

Each player character can upgrade their number of attack and defense dice as they complete quests and survive events.

There are only twelve years to get prepared for the war.

Each turn you have three movement you can use. For each step, though, you might have an encounter. These can be combats or skill checks or stat loss. Your turn ends when you can't go any further, or don't want to. Many areas can only be utilized if you begin your turn there.

You'll work together to build up reputation with four neighboring kingdoms. There are a variety of ways to do that and they can be different each game. You must also complete a personal quest. To win the game at the end of twelve years (three turns per player per year) you must have ten reputation with each of the four kingdoms and every player character must have completed his personal quest.

rpgseries: GEO - Living Greyhawk Geoff Regional Adventure
216060.name: Spearbreaker
216060.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Geoff Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The War between the Shadar Kai and the people of Cysgod Annwn is quickly coming to a crisis. New tactics among the enemy require the presence of the Celebrated Brightlings. Can heroes save the Angry Mountain and give back to one of the daughters something she had thought lost forever?

A Geoff Regional adventure for APLs 4-12, and Part Three of the Four Daughters of Geoff series.

rpgseries: GEO - Living Greyhawk Geoff Regional Adventure
216061.name: The Great Game
216061.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Geoff Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The Old Faith receives a prophecy from their Oracle: Old roads must be trod and forgotten allies called upon before the coming storm.

A Geoff Regional adventure for APLs 2-16.

rpgseries: GEO - Living Greyhawk Geoff Regional Adventure
216062.name: Gray Matter
216062.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Geoff Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The new king of the gnomes, King "Ingot" Quikbucon, is popular in the Stark Mounds. However, not everyone loves the king and an old companion requests an investigation. The trail may lead curious adventurers to hunt for something that Clan Ramsees has misplaced, and perhaps reveal more than they bargained for.

A Geoff regional adventure for APLs 4-12, and Part 2 of the Stark Contrasts series.

216063.name: Prince of the Oytwood
rpgseries: GEO - Living Greyhawk Geoff Regional Adventure
216063.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Geoff Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

It has been months now since the first kidnapping, and yet a member of the gray elves ruling body, the Weeping Council, remains missing. Those who helped the elves retrieve the other members tell tales of fey and plant creatures run amok in the Oytwood, and worse yet, the elves blame the Grand Duke of Geoff for their woes.

A Geoff Regional adventure for APLs 6-12, and Part 3 of the Crescent Moon Rising series.

rpgseries: GEO - Living Greyhawk Geoff Regional Adventure
216064.name: A Whisper in the Wind
216064.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Geoff Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Word has spread of the death of Caswallon the Green. Those who revered him are mourning and those who reviled him are celebrating. Everyone else waits for the coming storm to hit Geoff. Even now, as the warm breezes of spring melt away the cold of winter, a gentle and persistent whisper is heard. Who killed Caswallon? Was it the Old Faith? Was it the Brenin? Is he really dead? Will there be war?

A Geoff Regional adventure for APLs 4-12 and Part 3 of the Path of Purity series.

rpgseries: GEO - Living Greyhawk Geoff Regional Adventure
216065.name: Where All Shadows Lie
216065.description:
A Two-Round Living Greyhawk Geoff Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The leaders of Cysgod Annwn and the new mysterious leader of the Shadar Kai have decided to try and bring an end to their war and attack the real enemy: the forces of the dragon Hasforenses. However, when the new leader reveals himself, Sierra Blackblade makes a terrible choice and the leaders of both factions charge you with hunting her down and bringing justice upon her. Can you save the Last Daughter of Geoff from herself or will you be forced to sacrifice her upon the altar of war.

A Geoff Regional Adventure APL 6-12 and Part Four of the Daughters of Geoff.

216067.name: Big Pharma: Marketing and Malpractice
216067.description:
User Summary

Marketing and Malpractice adds more features and tools to Big Pharma including
- 'awarness' campaigns
- Perform clinical trials
- fudge results of clinical trials to help your products (but at the risk of your company's reputation)
- offer doctor's incentives for using selling your products
- the ability to set prices for products
- Machines to control flow and move items between buildings
- Bonuses that can be selected at the start of each game

rpgseries: PER - Living Greyhawk Perrenland Regional Adventures
216069.name: The Perrenland Informer
216069.description:
From the introduction:

Between the Yatil and Corrusk mountains lies the remote country known as the “Concantated Cantons of Perrenland,” or Perrenland, as it’s known to the rest of Oerth. Perrenland is a land of high mountains, grinding glaciers, alpine lakes, and small settlements. This also is the land of Lake Quag, the third largest body of fresh water in the Flanaess and home to some of its most fearsome monsters. To the north, the mountains of Perrenland fade into the steppes occupied by the Tiger and Wolf Nomads. To the south, the mountains mark the borders between an aggressive Ket, a tolerant Tusmit and a friendly Highfolk. Perrenland is isolationist in outlook and isolated physically, but to adventurers it represents some of the most rugged and unexplored terrain in the entire Flanaess.

Just as isolated in the real world is the continent of Australia and the islands of New Zealand; both located in the South Pacific. These countries form the core of Perrenland for the Living GreyhawkTM campaign. If you want to join the campaign and you live in these countries, Perrenland is the place for you.

216070.description:
In The Hunt for the Ring, one player takes the role of Frodo and his companions, who are journeying from the Shire to Rivendell, while up to four other players represent the Nazgûl who are trying to hunt down the hobbits. While traveling, Frodo and others must resist being corrupted by the Ring that he wears.

The Hunt for the Ring is a hidden movement game played in two chapters, with each chapter being played on a different game board. In the first chapter, the Frodo player attempts to move from the Shire to Bree, gaining corruption points if they fail to do so after sixteen turns. If the Frodo player succeeds, they can either record their exit point (and other game details) to play the second chapter at a later time, or they can continue immediately, with the second chapter having the Frodo player move from Bree to Rivendell. In this chapter, the Frodo player doesn't control the hobbits directly, but instead draws cards from a journey deck, with each card showing one of many paths to Rivendell.
216070.name: The Hunt for the Ring
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 26 - Francesco Nepitello; Co-designer of War of the Ring

216071.name: Clover's First Day of School
216071.description:
From the introduction:

How have you been? We’ve been doing really great. It’s been a fun summer, but there’s that chill in the air again and it’s the time when kids go back to school. Or, for some kids, they’ll go to school for the first time.

216072.name: Top Gun: Plot Twist Party Game
216072.description: In Top Gun: Plot Twist Party Game, you play as your favorite pilots from the movie as you do your best to maneuver and insult your way to be the winner of the Top Gun Trophy!

216074.name: Litterarum
216074.description:
Litterarum is a compact word game inspired by Tim Fowers' Paperback and Shh of Chris Handy.

Players try to score as many points as possible by building the most valuable words from available letters that are changing every round.
Letters are drawn from every players' hand and played simultaneously. Then a player on the left of the one holding the "inspiratione" card must create the most valuable word from letters in play, being followed by player on his left. Letters in a word may repeat freely.

Instead of standard letter cards players can play wild letters that can be used instead any other letter that is not currently in play. However, every wild letter card can be used in a word only once and does not score a point.

Every standard letter is worth a point. A player with the most valuable word (in case of deuce a player with the least amount of wild letters used in a word or a player whose word value was not beaten) becomes a winner of the round.

If a player doesn't want to score in a round, he may choose two other actions: getting an inspiration and passing. Inspiration can change owner only once per round, passing can be played anytime.

The winner of the round adds one card from draw pile among letters in play and then takes two of them back to his hand. After that, a player on his left hand picks one letter and so on until all the letters are taken. Then a new round begins.

When the winner of the round draws a "+1 littera" card, he puts it above the vowels card. From now, players repeat letter-picking phase for every such card in play, playing more letters, giving them more possibilities.

Game ends when the draw pile is empty. Players play one last round, winner gets the vowels card and then every player counts the amount of cards in hand.

A player with the most cards is a winner. If more players have equal amount of cards, a player with more wild letter cards in hand wins. In case of deuce a finalist sitting (clockwise) nearest to the player with inspiration card (or a player with an inspiration card himself) wins the game.

216076.name: Borodino
216076.description:
From Atari ST box
Napoleon's invasion of Russia in 1812 ended in a disastrous retreat from Moscow. One of the key factors leading to this was the failure to win more than a moral victory when his 131,000 men met 120,000 Russian troops at the small town of Borodino - 70 miles west of Moscow.
Borodino offers you the chance to rewrite history, become Napoleon and run your campaign strategy, or take the role of Prince Kutusov and lead the Russian defence.

ATARI BATTLESCAPES - by Dr. Peter Turcan

62 pages manual, including the history of the battle.
Unique 3D Graphical representation
Revolutionary Comminucation system which realistically recreates how orders can be misinterpreted down the chain of command.
Historicallly accurate map.
Laminated Battle Map.
Free "Write on - Rub off" Battlescape Pen.
One and Two player mode.




FUTURE SCENARIOS INCLUDE - AMADA, TRAFALGAR, ROMAN EMPIRE AND MORE.

216077.name: Viska 5!
216077.description:
"Give me five" in English.

Players move around the game board what represents different classrooms at school. There are combination of 5 dice on each classroom. Player in his turn rolls 5 dice up to 3 times and tries to get as many dice as possible from that combination.
Player gets mark for this subject according the number of dice that matches with the dice combination.
f.e. There are 4,4,5,4,3 at Geography classroom and player rolled three correct numbers: 4,6,1,5,3. He get "3" in Geography.

If everybody has all the marks the player with the highest average mark is the winner.

216078.name: Pora na kameleona
216078.description:
Welcome to the sunny Madagascar! You came here to make photos of one of the most interesting creatures - chameleons! Travel the Island and keep your eyes peeled for the perfect opportunity!

Chameleon Time is a dexterity party game in which players will try to make photos of 6 different chameleons. At the beginning of the turn the top card of chameleon stack is revealed. The card has two features: terrain and chameleon. Players will then locate the tile with corresponding terrain and time. Time is determined by the number of already made photos, so if for example a purple chameleon by the waterfall is revealed and players already captured 2 such chameleons, players will need to take the tile with waterfall and 2 time sections. Player who has 6 different chameleons immediately wins the game.

216079.name: Orcs Must Die!: Minion Pack
216079.description:
The Minion Pack contains:

Four Dwarf Grenadiers (enemy of the Unchained) - Dwarf Grenadiers can injure multiple Heroes simultaneously with thrown bombs that do a lot of damage, which scales up rapidly with each Onslaught. This encourages a Hero to fight them alone, thereby putting themselves at risk from other enemies.

Four Gnome Tinkerers (enemy of the Unchained) - Clever Gnomes will capture your Traps and turn them against you!

Four Goblin Sappers (enemy of the Order) - Devious Goblins will destroy your hard-earned traps! You have to kill them as quickly as possible or see your Fortress defenses fall apart before your eyes.

Two Cyclops (enemy of the Order) - Powerful and hard to kill, Cyclopses use unusual attack dice to deliver their impact.

This pack also contains new Minion Description Cards and Army Cards to shuffle into your decks so these Monsters can easily join the fray!

216080.name: Orcs Must Die!: Boss Pack
216080.description:
The Boss Pack contains:

Fire Lord (enemy of the Order) - A gigantic elemental who can "shoot" heroes from a distance, making him a knottier puzzle than usual to defend against.

Veyetality, Cyclops Mage (enemy of the Order) - A healer, who actually resurrects dead enemies - pulling their skulls right out of your skull pool, bringing enemies back to life, and forcing you to kill them again!

Swiftyhooves (enemy of the Unchained) - The Satyr King, who defends other Satyrs, and herds them towards your poor helpless Rift.

The Earth Lord (enemy of the Unchained) - Who he is "killed" he shatters into smaller pieces, then repeats the process. You have to kill 7 different enemies to eliminate all of him!

216081.name: The Clinging Shade
216081.description:
From publisher blurb:

The happy bride killed on her wedding day. The soldier who dies after the war is won. The long-waiting mother who succumbs in the childbirth bed. These sorts are the soil from which the Clinging Shade springs. Whenever players brush against an ironic tragedy, they should be wary. There’s always a chance that the victim will linger to haunt them and bring about their own terrible demise.

Sometimes, when a person has their life unjustly taken from them, their spirit refuses to pass on to their next plane of existence and they become a Clinging Shade. Struggling endlessly to sate a yearning that can’t be fulfilled, the Clinging Shade becomes obsessed with an individual among the living.

Once a person has been chosen as the object of its demented obsessions, the Clinging Shade will relentlessly pursue them. Oftentimes, months will pass before it ever reveals itself. As time presses on however, the Shade will only grow bolder and its actions more extreme.

216082.name: OWB: Allied Missions I
216082.description:
From publisher blurb:

OWB: ALLIED MISSIONS I is a collection of nine (9) support missions designed for WWII: Operation WhiteBox. Get Norway Ablaze, Desert Raiders of WWII, and Normandy Breakout all in one book! Drop your characters right into WWII action by launching commando raids in Norway, hunting panzers with the LRDG in North Africa, storming the beaches of Normandy, and much, much more!

OWB: Allied Missions I is designed for 3-6 characters of 1st-3rd level.

216083.name: The Altar of Corrosion
216083.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deep in the Bleached Lands, far from civilisation, foul gods and demi-gods made their home. Exiled there after the Mage Wars, acolytes and cultists soon followed and began to plague the land with their vile shrines and temples. One such temple was the Altar of Corrosion, dedicated to some unknown deity. The air is thick with poisonous fumes, and acid pools around the shrine, burning away anything that comes into contact. Few now worship at the Altar, although many ancient spells mention it, and so each year travellers visit the shrine, hoping to find something other than an early and painful death.

Need a quick map for an encounter?

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 20 x 30 map depiciting an acid-filled shrine. Set in a cave, the main chamber of the temple is separated by a lake of highly corrosive acid. The shrine itself is adorned with huge carved skulls, demonic statues and a huge ornate altar.

216084.name: The Black Monk: The Heron
216084.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Heron is the oldest figure in Elysia. She might even be older than the Black Monk. Neither of them has kept track. Neither knows when the land began. But the Heron keeps to her work. She keeps to herself. She makes no complaints about the state of things. And she accepts her fate.

Except. She doesn’t. When she’s alone, the crying starts. It’s not something she can even control anymore. But always in her ear, words follow, whispering like gossamer wind, “Patience. Patience…”


In The Black Monk, the characters are people living in a desolate, but vibrant world where time seems to have lost meaning. Living for decades, perhaps longer, in isolation from others, the people of Elysia toil in work, only to be visited once a year by the Black Monk.

In between these visits, their lives are interrupted by sometimes trivial and other times confusing events. Everything seems to fit together like an elongated jigsaw puzzle, but no one can see the starter pieces stretching across the horizon.
But they don’t complain. There is always more work. The village needs workers.

Then one evening, the sun stayed in the sky all day. When there should have been night, the sun remained. And now it feels as though it’s been years since the Black Monk came. But perhaps it was yesterday. Nothing is right…

Is that blood?

216085.name: Der Jager
216085.description:
From publisher blurb:

Humans. The most dangerous game. This is the territory of the man known as Der Jager. Born into privilege, the hunter is a man of conviction with a zeal to chase the ultimate prey. He has now set his sights on those with super human abilities as he goes from the most dangerous game to the deadliest catch.

216086.name: Alchemist Extracts IV (PRD)
216086.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Alchemist Extracts is a simple document that collects the alchemist extractlist, and all extracts in it, for easy use. The extract lists are broken up by level and school, and the extracts of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 4th-level alchemist extracts.

This is the PRD-Only version, containing information from the PRD.

216087.name: Alchemist Extracts IV (3PP)
216087.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Alchemist Extracts is a simple document that collects the alchemist extractlist, and all extracts in it, for easy use. The extract lists are broken up by level and school, and the extracts of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 4th-level alchemist extracts.

This is the 3pp+PRD version, containing information from the PRD and select third-party products.

216088.name: Payoff Pitch Baseball: 1954 Cards
216088.description:
Payoff Pitch Baseball: 1954 Cards is a set of 662 cards — including players and parks — printed on high-gloss heavy cardstock for use with the Payoff Pitch Baseball base game.

L/R splits on batter cards as with all Payoff Pitch Baseball sets.

216089.name: Payoff Pitch Baseball: 1948 Cards
216089.description:

216090.name: Payoff Pitch Baseball: 1940 Cards
216090.description:
Payoff Pitch Baseball: 1940 Cards is a set of 565 cards — including players and parks — printed on high-gloss heavy cardstock for use with the Payoff Pitch Baseball base game.

L/R splits on batter cards as with all Payoff Pitch Baseball sets.

216091.description:
Unlock! is a cooperative card game inspired by escape rooms that uses a simple system which allows you to search scenes, combine objects, and solve riddles. Play Unlock! to embark on great adventures, while seated at a table using only cards and a companion app that can provide clues, check codes, monitor time remaining, etc.

In the adventure Unlock! The Formula, The Department has lost contact with one of their chemists, Dr. Hoffman. Your mission is to retrieve the truth serum he had been developing. Deep in the New York subway tunnels, you must seek out his laboratory, locate the doctor, and recover the formula before time runs out. The clock is ticking...can you escape?

An included ten-card tutorial allows you to learn how to play without reading the game rules. Note: Unlock! requires a free application to be downloaded from the App Store or Google Play. Once downloaded, an internet connection is not required during game play.
216091.name: Unlock! The Formula

216092.description:
Unlock! is a cooperative card game inspired by escape rooms that uses a simple system which allows you to search scenes, combine objects, and solve riddles. Play Unlock! to embark on great adventures, while seated at a table using only cards and a companion app that can provide clues, check codes, monitor time remaining, etc.

In the cartoon-style adventure Unlock! Squeek & Sausage, you need to stop the mad Professor Noside from destroying the world. In your attempt to thwart his plot, the evil genius has caught you in a trap, and you can't stop him until you've found a way out. Can you escape and foil his plot before the clock hits zero?

An included ten-card tutorial allows you to learn how to play without reading the game rules. Note: Unlock! requires a free application to be downloaded from the App Store or Google Play. Once downloaded, an internet connection is not required during game play.
216092.name: Unlock! Squeek & Sausage

216094.description:
Unlock! is a cooperative card game inspired by escape rooms that uses a simple system which allows you to search scenes, combine objects, and solve riddles. Play Unlock! to embark on great adventures, while seated at a table using only cards and a companion app that can provide clues, check codes, monitor time remaining, etc.

In Unlock! The Island of Doctor Goorse, you and your team have crash-landed on the island of an eccentric antiques collector. Two to six players will be split into teams, separated in the crash, and forced to escape from two separate starting points. The twists and turns of this challenging adventure will test even the most talented escape artists. With your lines of communication cut, can you and your teammates find a way off the island?

An included ten-card tutorial allows you to learn how to play without reading the game rules. Note: Unlock! requires a free application to be downloaded from the App Store or Google Play. Once downloaded, an internet connection is not required during game play.
216094.name: Unlock! The Island of Doctor Goorse

216096.name: Santa & Rudolph Do Christmas
216096.description:
From diskette
Here's a Xmas game with a difference.
Take Santa round the world to deliver prezzies, and protect from all hazards.
Work through 3 different screens for the location change.

User summary
This is an Amiga PD/Freeware game. Diskette says Santa & Rudolph Do Xmas, but game screen say Santa & Rudolph Do Christmas
Coded by Ian West
Graphic and music by Jonathan Eggelton

216097.name: Payoff Pitch Baseball: 1933 Cards
216097.description:
Payoff Pitch Baseball: 1933 Cards is a set of 525 cards — including players and parks — printed on high-gloss heavy cardstock for use with the Payoff Pitch Baseball base game.

L/R splits on batter cards as with all Payoff Pitch Baseball sets.

216098.name: Payoff Pitch Baseball: 1964 Cards
216098.description:

216099.name: Payoff Pitch Baseball: 1964 Cards
216099.description:

216100.description:

216101.name: Payoff Pitch Baseball: 1977 Cards
216101.description:
Payoff Pitch Baseball: 1977 Cards is a set of 926 cards — including players and parks — printed on high-gloss heavy cardstock for use with the Payoff Pitch Baseball base game.

216102.name: Mazo de Orjetivo Secreto
216102.description:
From Publisher's Blurb:

¿Te parece que tus partidas de Lejías del Espacio son caóticas? Florecilla… ya verás lo que es el Caos, ya. Tú dale estas cartas a tus jugadores al principio de la partida y verás como hasta Loki se marcharía de tu partida porque esto no es serio, hombre ya.

216103.name: Operation Desert Weirdness
216103.description:
Published in Command # 16, Operation Desert Weirdness expands the Desert Storm: The Mother of All Battles base game. This expansion adds new counters for Japanese, Soviet and Iranian. And new rules and scenarios for iranian intervention in the Iraqi side, and Soviet intervention in the iraqi or Coaltion side.

The Desert Storm: The Mother of All Battles base game is a one- or two-player operational simulation of the Gulf War. It focused almost exclusively on the Coalition ground war that liberated Kuwait and shattered the occupying Iraqi army.

The game included a 22" x 34" hex map of the significant terrain in the Kuwaiti Theatre of Operations, 192 counters, and 20 pages of rules, charts, and tables.

Rules are split into both a basic and an advanced game. There are separate rules for solitaire play.

The U.S./Coalition player had to completely liberate Kuwait to have a chance to win. If Kuwait was liberated within 12 game turns, the player who has gained the most 'points' in inflicting losses on their opponent, was the winner. The Coalition player had to be aggressive in order to completely clear Iraqi units from all Kuwaiti cities, towns, oilfields, and airfields, otherwise the Iraqi player would win.

216104.name: Payoff Pitch Baseball: 1979 Cards
216104.description:
Payoff Pitch Baseball: 1979 Cards is a set of 941 cards — including players and parks — printed on high-gloss heavy cardstock for use with the Payoff Pitch Baseball base game.

L/R splits on batter cards as with all Payoff Pitch Baseball sets.

216105.name: Payoff Pitch Baseball: 1982 Cards
216105.description:
Payoff Pitch Baseball: 1982 Cards is a set of 954 cards — including players and parks — printed on high-gloss heavy cardstock for use with the Payoff Pitch Baseball base game.

L/R splits on batter cards as with all Payoff Pitch Baseball sets.

216106.name: Payoff Pitch Baseball: 1991 Cards
216106.description:
Payoff Pitch Baseball: 1991 Cards is a set of 1,002 cards — including players and parks — printed on high-gloss heavy cardstock for use with the Payoff Pitch Baseball base game.

L/R splits on batter cards as with all Payoff Pitch Baseball sets.

216107.name: Payoff Pitch Baseball: 1994 Cards
216107.description:
Payoff Pitch Baseball: 1994 Cards is a set of 1,018 cards — including players and parks — printed on high-gloss heavy cardstock for use with the Payoff Pitch Baseball base game.

L/R splits on batter cards as with all Payoff Pitch Baseball sets.

216108.description:
Payoff Pitch Baseball: 2012 Cards is a set of 1,325 cards — including players and parks — printed on high-gloss heavy cardstock for use with the Payoff Pitch Baseball base game.

L/R splits on batter cards as with all Payoff Pitch Baseball sets.

216109.name: Payoff Pitch Baseball: 2013 Cards
216109.description:
Payoff Pitch Baseball: 2013 Cards is a set of 1,289 cards — including players and parks — printed on high-gloss heavy cardstock for use with the Payoff Pitch Baseball base game.

216110.name: Payoff Pitch Baseball: 2014 Cards
216110.description:
Payoff Pitch Baseball: 2014 Cards is a set of 1,324 cards — including players and parks — printed on high-gloss heavy cardstock for use with the Payoff Pitch Baseball base game.

216111.name: Payoff Pitch Baseball: 2015 Cards
216111.description:
Payoff Pitch Baseball: 2015 Cards is a set of 1,224 cards — including players and parks — printed on high-gloss heavy cardstock for use with the Payoff Pitch Baseball base game.

L/R splits on batter cards as with all Payoff Pitch Baseball sets.

216113.name: Alpine Ski VR
216113.description:
Alpine Ski VR by Suchworks Studios brings the thrill of skiing to your desktop. There are three different game types: Slalom, Freestyle and Heliski. Beat the splits on the 6 slalom levels, pull some tricks on the 6 freestyle levels, or cruise around the 100km2 offpiste; complete with your own helicopter!

Source: The Developer Website.

216114.name: Bamboo EP
216114.description:
User Summary

A collection of bamboo themed games.

216115.name: Fist of Physics
216115.description:
User Summary

Punch a robot in the face! Robots are running wild in San Francisco. Fight through multiple rounds against different opponents to save the city.

216116.name: Nacho Libre
216116.description:
User Summary

A wrestling game with added mini-games, based on the Jack Black film.

216117.description:
Description from the publisher:

Clones of the former Presidents of the United States battle it out to become the Supreme President of These United States! Each body at your feet and every turn around the arena is another vote in your pocket. Get rid of the opposing Presidents by killing them, corrupting them, or having them dragged away kicking and screaming. Survive the carnage by dodging, bribing, and making treaties with your opponents. Your own President may be lost in the fight, but another will always rise up to take their place.

Presidential Knife Fight brings long-dead Presidents back to life for ruthless combat and historical satire in a card game for 3-6 players. The first 43 Presidents- George Washington through George W. Bush, are all represented in card form, each with a unique ability based on their time in office.

Each player begins the game with 3 President cards and gets to choose which order to play them. Maybe George Washington to go first, then Bill Clinton to escape every danger, and clean up with Teddy Roosevelt, the unstoppable killing machine. Gain votes by killing opposing Presidents, surviving a full turn around the table, or through special abilities. Get 5 votes to win the game and become Supreme President of These United States!

Each turn, a player gets 3 actions which they can spend on stabbing their enemies, drawing cards, playing cards, or using their presidential ability; allowing them to build their turn as offensively or defensively as they'd like. Presidents can die from wounds or be thrown out of office from corruption, but dead players re-enter the fight with a new President at the start of their next turn, ensuring no one is out for too long. Players use a shared deck of Action cards, filled with Attacks to kill your enemies, Reactions to keep you alive, and Executive Actions to change up the game. Steal someone's cards with the Patriot Act, have your Scapegoat take the fall for you, or rig the re-election to make sure you never lose!
216117.name: Presidential Knife Fight

216118.name: Pokémon TCG: XY
216118.description: In this theme deck box you will find: 60-card deck, 1 card checklist, 1 metallic coin, 2-player playmat and rulesheet, 1 code card to play the deck online, 1 deckbox and damage counters.

216119.name: Pokémon TCG: Black & White
216119.description:
This theme deck Includes:
1 60 card Pokemon deck
1 metallic coin
1 rulebook/card list
1 playmat
1 sheet of damage counters
1 Deck box

216120.name: Pokémon TCG: Sun & Moon Theme Deck
216120.description:
This theme deck Includes:
1 60 card Pokemon deck
1 metallic coin
1 rulebook/card list
1 playmat
1 sheet of damage counters
1 Deck box

Each deck includes a GX card of a final evolution of the Alola Starter Pokemon.

216121.name: Pokémon TCG: HeartGold & SoulSilver
216121.description:
This theme deck Includes:
1 60 card Pokemon deck
1 metallic coin
1 rulebook/card list
1 playmat
1 sheet of damage counters
1 Deck box

216122.name: Rolling Thunder (Issue 3 - Holiday Special 2016)
216122.description:
From publisher blurb:

All new, fan-written material (with a seasonal flavour) for Cakbread & Walton’s role-playing games, including:

An adventure for OneDice Spies: Martinis and Masterminds
A double bill of cringeworthy classic OneDice B- Movies
A Christmas caper for the forthcoming OneDice Ghost Hunters
1970s moral dilemmas in a OneDice Spies: Cold War adventure
Supernatural adventure in Sydney for OneDice Urban Fantasy
Plus encounter tables and an interview!

216123.description:
This edition includes the base game and some add-ons: Gambit Set, Crisis - Heroes, Crisis - Events, Crisis - Fleets & Fortresses, Crisis - Bases & Battleships, (128 + 68 cards).


Star Realms is a fast paced deck-building card game of outer space combat. It combines the fun of a deck-building game with the interactivity of Trading Card Game style combat. As you play, you make use of Trade to acquire new Ships and Bases from the cards being turned face up in the Trade Row from the Trade Deck. You use the Ships and Bases you acquire to either generate more Trade or to generate Combat to attack your opponent and their bases. When you reduce your opponent’s score (called Authority) to zero, you win!
216123.name: Star Realms Special Edition

216125.name: An Afternoon Outing Perrenland Adaptation Sheet
rpgseries: PER - Living Greyhawk Perrenland Regional Adventures
216125.description:
From the introduction:

Players have left the town of Elfstadt and are travelling to a little village on the west bank of the Velverdyva known as Strasveld. The town is a stop-over point for the Rhennee river folk on their journey up the river. The river mentioned in the module is a tributary that flows into the Velverdyva river.

User summary:

This concise document provides guidance to Dungeon Masters for the process of utilizing both rounds of an "Adaptable" scenario for the Perrenland region: ADP1-07a: An Afternoon Outing (Round 1) and ADP1-07b: An Afternoon Outing (Round 2).

216126.name: Adaptation Sheet for Festival Knight, Perrenland
rpgseries: PER - Living Greyhawk Perrenland Regional Adventures
216126.description:
From the introduction:

This scenario is set in Traft City, which is the biggest settlement of Traft Canton, in the nation of Perrenland. The city is an industrious settlement of some 12,000 inhabitants, lying on the eastern shore of Lake Quag, one of the biggest freshwater bodies in the Flanaess.

User summary:

This concise document provides guidance to Dungeon Masters for the process of utilizing an "Adaptable" scenario for the Perrenland region: ADP1-05: Festival Knight.

216127.name: A Plea From Beyond the Grave - Adaptation Sheet (Perrenland)
rpgseries: PER - Living Greyhawk Perrenland Regional Adventures
216127.description:
From the introduction:

It may be helpful for the GM to ascertain if any of the characters being run have played Vortrote's Legacy prior to this adventure as some mention can be made during this adventure in order to establish the illusion of continuity in this adventure.

User summary:

This concise document provides guidance to Dungeon Masters for the process of utilizing an "Adaptable" scenario for the Perrenland region: ADP1-08: A Plea From Beyond the Grave.

216128.name: Dog Magic
216128.description:
A 2-player, interactive, deductive reasoning and dexterity game for all ages.

Play requires one Overlord to set up the board, hiding the treasure within the specially constructed pockets. The other player manipulates the board, searching for the hidden treasure(s) by dislodging the pocket covers.

The object of the game is to recover all hidden treasure, and either consume it or exchange for victory points.

Play time varies, depending on player aptitude and general intelligence.

216129.name: Sinkhole - A Perrenland Adaptation Sheet
rpgseries: PER - Living Greyhawk Perrenland Regional Adventures
216129.description:
From the introduction:

The farm is several miles to the south east of the village of Kottsmort on the edge of the Sepia Uplands and close to territory claimed by Traft...The hobgoblins and goblins are forerunners of Iuz's invasion into the area.

User summary:

This concise document provides guidance to Dungeon Masters for the process of utilizing an "Adaptable" scenario for the Perrenland region: ADP1-09: Sinkhole.

216130.name: Snake in the Grass - Perrenland Regional Adaptable
rpgseries: PER - Living Greyhawk Perrenland Regional Adventures
216130.description:
From the introduction:

This version of the scenario has been adapted for play in Perrenland. The villain in this scenario, Malendril, is a spy. He reports directly to a superior named Katenka and works for the Cult of Iuz since that is the only cult in the area who can reliably reach beyond the grave to punish those who offend against it. Malendril has spent several years infiltrating the power structure of the City of Traft in Traft Canton and becoming an important figure there.

User summary:

This concise document provides guidance to Dungeon Masters for the process of utilizing an "Adaptable" scenario for the Perrenland region: ADP1-06: A Snake in the Grass.

216131.name: Adaption Sheet for What Lies Beneath (Perrenland)
rpgseries: PER - Living Greyhawk Perrenland Regional Adventures
216131.description:
From the introduction:

This scenario is set in the Village Of Aerden. Aerden, is approximately 35 miles south of Traft City, and is situated just slightly in from the coast. The village nestles in between Lake Quag and the mighty Clatspur Ranges towering directly above to the east. It is a small village with about 900 inhabitants.

User summary:

This concise document provides guidance to Dungeon Masters for the process of utilizing an "Adaptable" scenario for the Perrenland region: ADP1-04: What Lies Beneath.

216132.description:
Clans of Caledonia is a mid-to-heavy economic game set in 19th-century Scotland. At this time, Scotland made the transition from an agricultural to an industrialized country that heavily relied on trade and export. In the following years, food production increased significantly to feed the population growth. Linen was increasingly substituted by the cheaper cotton and raising sheep was given high importance. More and more distilleries were founded and whisky became the premium alcoholic beverage in Europe.

Players represent historic clans with unique abilities and compete to produce, trade and export agricultural goods and of course whisky!

The game ends after five rounds. Each round consists of the three phases:

1. Players' turns
2. Production phase
3. Round scoring

1. Players take turns and do one of eight possible actions, from building, to upgrading, trading and exporting. When players run out of money, they pass and collect a passing bonus.

2. In the production phase, each player collects basic resources, refined goods and cash from their production units built on the game map. Each production unit built makes income visible on the player mat. Refined goods require the respective basic resource.

3. Players receive VPs depending on the scoring tile of the current round.

The game comes with eight different clans, a modular board with 16 configurations, eight port bonuses and eight round scoring tiles.
216132.name: Clans of Caledonia

216135.name: Drawn Inn
216135.description:
Description from the designer:

A roll-and-write city-building game for lots of players and four six-sided dice. Players develop their side-view city until any player has built on each of their eleven blocks.

With each roll, the active player chooses two dice to activate one of their own blocks and the remaining two dice activate a block for everyone else. In an activated block you can draw a new building or activate each existing building (scoring points or possibly upgrading).

Once anyone has built a building in each block, the game ends. Anyone with no empty blocks may activate one more time, then the highest score wins.

216137.description: Custom dice for Shadows of Brimstone featuring various symbols and colors representing each of the game's classes. Each set of dice comes with 8 custom six-sided dice.
boardgameaccessory: Shadows of Brimstone: City of the Ancients
Shadows of Brimstone: Swamps of Death
216137.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Kickstarter Custom Dice

216138.name: Achievus
216138.description:
Achievus is a cooperative board game of positive interaction. The game is about achieving a common goal together with an alliance while reviewing and discussing the 17 Success Principles written by Dr. Napoleon Hill (author of the classic book Think and Grow Rich). When the alliance collects more than 2,000 PMA (Positive Mental Attitude) points together they win the game by accomplishing the highest achievement level. If a player in the alliance loses all of his or her 11 Opportunity Time Tokens the game ends for the alliance. As a result, the players compare their alliance’s PMA (Positive Mental Attitude) point total with a range of achievement levels.

This Achievus board game base set includes two games in one, “Achievus Junior” A.K.A. “Achievus Mind-Set” (2 to 4 players, Ages 7+) and “Achievus Original” A.K.A. “Achievus Challenge” (1 to 4 players, Ages 14+). Achievus game includes 112 Cards, 4 Conscious/Subconscious Mind Boards, 4 Golden Rule Applied Tokens, 60 PMA Point Tokens, 44 Opportunity Time Tokens, 2 Token Bags, and the rules for both original and junior game variations.

Achievus Junior – Game Play Overview

While playing Achievus Junior each player takes a turn in clockwise order to complete a round of play. A player takes his or her turn by following these 5 steps;

Step 1) Draw Step - Draw up to 6 cards, if needed.
Step 2) Call Step - Call out a card to a player for a possible match.
Step 3) Give & Take Step - Give and Take a card with a player.
Step 4) Play Step - May play down any needed pairs for the player’s collection of the 17 principles,
Step 5) Redraw Step - Redraw up to 6 cards.

If the players don’t have a match during Step 2 then the calling player will lose one of his 11 Opportunity Time Tokens. When it’s a match both players add the needed principle card to his or her collection of 17 principle cards. Then they read the principle meaning from the card aloud and discuss it with their alliance. The goal of Achievus Junior is for each player to help one another to collect a card of all 17 principles, without losing all of his or her Opportunity Time Tokens. Only then will the players earn the Golden Rule Applied Tokens, the ultimate achievement of the game.

Achievus Original – Game Play Overview

While Playing Achievus Original, players will experience prosperity and adversity events throughout the game, earning PMA points and Action Stars. All players’ follow these 6 consecutive steps together, each step before the next, to complete a round of play.

Step 1) Draw Step - Each player draws five cards, resolving any adversity or prosperity events.
Step 2) Sacrifice Step - Each player may or may not choose to sacrifice his turn, discarding his cards and losing only one Opportunity Time Token this way.
Step 3) Collect Step - Each player may choose to collect the cards they have previously played in their Conscious Mind Section to earn PMA points and Action Stars or may choose to continue gathering without collecting at this time.
Step 4) Play Step - Each player plays his or her cards in consecutive order in any players’ Conscious Mind Section, earning PMA points for giving.
Step 5) Missed Opportunity Step - Each player loses one of his or her 11 Opportunity Time Tokens for each principle card not played then discards them.
Step 6) Read Step – Read the top discarded principle card. Players then share aloud how they have applied this principle in his or her life with their alliance.

The goal of Achievus Original is to strategize among the alliance to make the best possible plays. Players need to prepare for Adversity Events that may take away the Principle Cards in a player’s Conscious Mind Section. Players work together to gather all 17 Principle Cards in one player’s Conscious Mind Section. When this is accomplished, that player collects the cards (During Step 3) which includes all 17 principle cards. Only then will the players earn the Golden Rule Applied Tokens, the ultimate achievement of the game.

216139.name: NIVA
216139.description:
NIVA is a pacifistic exploration art game.

The player slips into the role of a mighty forest god to restore the harmony in a mesmerizing forest and relieve it of a mysterious infestation. This shuddersome, mothlike infestation is drawn to the conflicts of the forest's inhabitants. Through observation and by using the abilities of nurturing and withering fascinating plants the player can solve said conflicts. NIVA's scenic art style, relaxing music and simple but intriguing game mechanics invite to explore the forest and have a rest from the stressful everyday life.

Source: The Game Website.

216143.name: The Stacks
216143.description:
The Stacks was never a cartridge release. The code is written for the 6502 processor and runs within an Atari 2600 emulator. A tie-in for the novel Ready Player One by Ernest Cline. According to its description in the novel, The Stacks is a Pitfall rip-off.

Source: The Game Website.

216145.name: High/Low Farms
216145.description:
High/Low Farms is on the surface a trick taking game, but it's heart is in a classic Euro-style economy game. Over three rounds, players take tricks with cards that have duo values. Depending on the round, they will try to be the highest or lowest in value and then choose how to use the card they win.

Players may choose three ways to use the card they win by either choosing to use it as a farm, turn the card in for a resource to put on their farm, or turn the card in for money. After each round, players may trade between themselves for the goods they need or with the farmers market to make the best use of their goods for points.

216146.name: Star Wars Simon
216146.description:
Description from the publisher:

Jedi must use the Force to defeat Darth Vader in the Star Wars Simon game! Remember the flashing light sequences on this unique game unit designed like Darth Vader's mask and repeat the pattern back correctly to play to the beats of the iconic Imperial March. Do, or do not; there is no try against the Star Wars Simon game!

216147.name: The Lost Handbook
216147.description:
From the Back of the Book:

Within the mouldering, crudely scanned pages of this makeshift tome is revealed the veritable Dead Sea Scrolls of the AD&D game. Okay, maybe that's laying it on a little thick, but this wouldn't be an orange-spined 1st Edition book without a little hyperbole on the back! So, ahem, prepare your mind for a phantasmagorical feast that will sustain its imaginings for eons to come. Like an infinite sheet pizza! With breadsticks!

From the Title Page:
A COMPENDIUM OF OFFICIAL STRATEGIC REVIEW AND DRAGON MAGAZINE RULES UPDATES FOR THE AD&D™ GAME. TOTALING THE LENGTH OF THE PLAYER’S HANDBOOK PLUS DUNGEON MASTER’S GUIDE, THIS WORK COMMENTS ON, EXPANDS, AND ILLUMINATES THE AD&D™ SYSTEM. EVERY ARTICLE THAT DESCRIBES WHAT IS OFFICIAL IN DRAGON, OR STATES THAT IT IS OFFICIAL, OR THAT WAS SCRIBED BY GARY GYGAX APPEARS HEREIN. UNEARTHED ARCANA IS OBSOLETE.

User Description:
This fan-compiled book gathers all of the articles published in the early TSR magazines, Strategic Review and Dragon Magazine, written by Gygax, Kuntz, Moore, Mentzer, and Lakofka. It was briefly posted on LULU as a POD product printed at cost in 2015, but was removed after only 2 months.

rpgseries: PER - Living Greyhawk Perrenland Regional Adventures
216148.name: Pig Tales
216148.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Adventure

From the introduction:
